# circle_data { #artpack.circle_data }

```python
circle_data(
    x,
    y,
    radius,
    color=None,
    fill=None,
    n_points=100,
    group_var=False,
    group_value='circle_',
)
```

Generate data for plotting a circle as a DataFrame.

Creates a data frame of (x, y) coordinates representing a circle with a specified center and radius.

## Notes {.doc-section .doc-section-notes}

The output is designed for use with `geom_path` and `geom_polygon` geoms in `plotnine` for generative art.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name        | Type         | Description                                                                                                                     | Default     |
|-------------|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------|
| x           | float or int | The center x-coordinate of the circle.                                                                                          | _required_  |
| y           | float or int | The center y-coordinate of the circle.                                                                                          | _required_  |
| radius      | float or int | The radius of the circle. Must be greater than 0.                                                                               | _required_  |
| color       | str          | The outline color of the circle. Default None.                                                                                  | `None`      |
| fill        | str          | The fill color of the circle. Default None.                                                                                     | `None`      |
| n_points    | int          | Number of points to generate along the circle's perimeter. Must be an integer >= 10 for a reasonable approximation of a circle. | `100`       |
| group_var   | bool         | Whether to include a grouping variable in the output.                                                                           | `False`     |
| group_value | str          | Prefix for the grouping variable name. Required if `group_var` is True.                                                         | `"circle_"` |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|--------|--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| data   | pl.DataFrame | A DataFrame containing the circle's coordinates with columns:  - x: x-coordinates of points along the circle's perimeter  - y: y-coordinates of points along the circle's perimeter  - color: outline color (if specified)  - fill: fill color (if specified)  - group: grouping variable (if group_var is True) |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
from artpack.circles import circle_data
from plotnine import ggplot, aes, geom_path, coord_equal

one_circle = circle_data(x=0, y=0, radius=5)
(ggplot(one_circle, aes("x", "y")) + geom_path(color="green") + coord_equal())
```
